newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West Coast crudes ease with WTI, talk light.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West Coast crudes ease with WTI, talk light.

text.p: U.S. West Coast crude prices eased Tuesday with benchmark West Texas Intermediate (WTI), while differentials remained unchanged amid limited traders talk, players said.
The region's main Alaska North Slope (ANS) seller declined once again to offer crude this week, but said they would consider bids for May or April cargoes.
Differentials remained at the last level done -- $0.91 cents off WTI.
ARCO on Tuesday said it would ship 100 percent of April crude nominated on Line 63. No deals would get done until shippers had a few days to figure out their supply needs for the month.
Outright prices for Kern River remained steady Tuesday. Kern River, a key heavy grade, ranged $15.00/15.10 a barrel.
